quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Metallica
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, steve, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who performed the song Crocodile Rock in 1972?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elton John

questions.question: Did country artist Keith Urban release the song Raining on Sunday in 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Ride the Lightning is Metallicas debut album, released in 1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year did The Steve Miller Band release the song Fly Like an Eagle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1976

questions.question: What band performed the song Peace Frog in 1970?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doors

questions.question: Which of these rock bands recorded the song When Will It Rain in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackyl

questions.question: In what year did Guns N Roses release the song November Rain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1992

questions.question: Metallica was formed in Downey, California in 1981.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these female artists released the song Rain in 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madonna

questions.question: Which member of Metallica was fired less than two years after joining the band in 1981?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Mustaine

questions.question: Which of these Grunge bands released the song Rooster in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice in Chains

questions.question: Which member of Metallica died in a bus accident in Sweden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cliff Burton

questions.question: In 2000 heavy metal band Metallica sued the Napster file-sharing network.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Beastie Boys performed the song Brass Monkey in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Elvis Presley released the song Kentucky Rain in 1970.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Artist
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This artist has had more songs than any other singer on the country charts – 167 as of November, 2005.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Jones

questions.question: These female country singers released the song heard in the sound clip in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Judds

questions.question: What band gave us the song Low Rider in 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War

questions.question: Which band performed Running on Empty in 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackson Browne

questions.question: In 1982, this band released the song heard in the sound clip, a fusion of southern rock and bluegrass which incorporates characters from 19th century American literature (including Tom Sawyer, Huck Finn and Rip Van Winkle).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alabama

questions.question: Which song by Jerry Reed, released in 1977, is the theme song to the movie Smokey and The Bandit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East Bound  Down

questions.question: As of 2007, this country artist has had more albums certified gold or platinum in the US than any other country artist (only Elvis Presley and The Beatles have more overall).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Strait

questions.question: Finish the title to the 1984 song by Sammy Hagar I Cant Drive____.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 55

questions.question: Lynyrd Skynyrd performed the song Call Me the Breeze in 1974.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Name the Hank Williams, Jr. song featured in the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Family Tradition

questions.question: This artist, nicknamed the Silver Fox, released the country hit heard in the sound clip in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Rich

questions.question: This artist recorded the song in the sound clip in 1982.  It describes an encounter with the ghost of Hank Williams.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Allen Coe

questions.question: Which song by Bruce Springsteen is about a little drag racer with big dreams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Racing In The Street

questions.question: What color Corvette did Prince sing about in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: red

questions.question: Lead vocalist of Metallica James Hetfield got burned on stage in 1992.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Sound Clip
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, opry, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This singer almost went down in the same plane crash as Buddy Holly, but (fortunately for him) gave up his seat to the Big Bopper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waylon Jennings

questions.question: Which of these is not a song on horn bands Blood, Sweat  Tears second, self-titled album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucretia MacEvil

questions.question: The song featured in the sound clip was a #1 US country single for this artist in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronnie Milsap

questions.question: The recording featured in the sound clip was a track from this artists Wild  Blue album in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Anderson

questions.question: This artists career spanned over fifty years with Folsom Prison Blues in 1956, to the 2006 postumus album, American V: A Hundred Highways.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Cash

questions.question: Roger Miller recorded this song, featured in the sound clip, in 1965.

options.text: Ruby, Dont Take Your Love to Town

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King of the Road

questions.question: This country artist may be best known for his role as Snowman in the Smokey and the Bandit.films.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Reed

questions.question: This band charted its first horn band hit, the cover of Brenda Holloways Youve Made Me So Very Happy, in early 1969.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood, Sweat  Tears

questions.question: The artist who recorded the song featured in the sound clip, also recorded which of the following country songs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhinestone Cowboy

questions.question: Vince Gill scored his first US Country Top Ten with the tune featured in the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Grand Ole Opry member released the hit featured in the sound clip in 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Paycheck

questions.question: This band from Chicago had some regional success in the mid 60s, but adding horns in 1969 proved to be their vehicle to a national breakthrough. Vehicle was their first major hit single.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ides of March

questions.question: Born Harold Lloyd Jenkins, this artist has had numerous successful country hits, including the song featured in the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Conway Twitty

questions.question: Rock band Chicago had to change their name due to a legal problem. What was the bands original name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Transit Authority

questions.question: Which of the following female country artists was a coal miners daughter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Loretta Lynn

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, rodgers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was legendary vocalist of jazz-rock band Blood, Sweat  Tears?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Clayton-Thomas

questions.question: Originally called the New Yardbirds, this group changed its name after The Whos Keith Moon and John Entwistle said this new group would fail miserably.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: The song Bidin My Time is from what musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Girl Crazy

questions.question: Name the horn band and its leader, famous for performing the 1970 hit single Get It On.

options.text: John Phillip Sousa - The Ides of March

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Chase - Chase

questions.question: In My Fair Lady Henry Higgins sings the song On the Street Where You Live.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Name the lead singer for the Ides of March, who has also performed with other notable bands such as 38 Special, Chase, and Survivor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Peterik

questions.question: I have confidence in sunshine. I have confidence in rain are the opening lines of the song I Have Confidence from The Sound of Music.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which song from the musical The Music Man is performed by an ensemble?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iowa Stubborn

questions.question: This band was initially called The Tradewinds.  They eventually settled upon the name of a mythological river.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Styx

questions.question: This band derived its moniker from the combination of the names of two blues musicians.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink Floyd

questions.question: American rock singer and producer Genya Ravan sang for what West Coast horn band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ten Wheel Drive

questions.question: Lighthouse, a band that added an amplified violin and viola to the line up, originated in what city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toronto

questions.question: Which of these songs does not feature Rodgers and Hammerstein as composer and lyricist?

options.text: People Will Say Were in Love

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh, Lady Be Good

questions.question: In the musical Les Miserables, which character sings the solo I Dreamed a Dream?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fantine

questions.question: The song Aint Misbehavin, written by Fats Waller, is credited to the show of the same name, but actually had its Broadway debut in what revue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot Chocolate

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, sebastian. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This band, whose members included Jack Bruce and Ginger Baker, considered themselves the best-of-the-best, and named themselves accordingly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cream

questions.question: Stairway to Heaven was a mega-hit for which British band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: Dream On was released on this bands debut album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aerosmith

questions.question: This band, whose members included Ray Manzarek and John Densmore, took their name from the title of a book by Aldous Huxley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doors

questions.question: What short lived band released the song Sunshine of Your Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cream

questions.question: What influential rock band had a hit with Blackbird?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: This band, fronted by musician John Sebastian, derives its name from a song called Coffee Blues by blues musician Mississippi John Hurt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lovin Spoonful

questions.question: This bands manager created its name from one of his poems which describes a collection of aliens who secretly guide Earths history. Burnin for You was a big hit from their Fire of Unknown Origin album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Öyster Cult

questions.question: Which classic rock band sang the hit song, Light My Fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doors

questions.question: This band is named after the 18th century agriculturalist who invented the seed drill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jethro Tull

questions.question: This band was named after a common 1960s drug reference.  They released the song Black Water, a number one hit in 1974.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doobie Brothers

questions.question: This band takes its name from a sexual device in the William Burroughs novel, Naked Lunch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steely Dan

questions.question: Paranoid is the title track of what bands album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Sabbath

questions.question: Originally called Earth, this band changed its name after a bandmember was given an occult book in Latin and had a vision of a black hooded figure standing at the foot of his bed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Sabbath

questions.question: Who recorded Baba O Riley, the theme song for CSI: New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Who

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Duo and Song
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, sail, feelgood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who recorded the sorrowful song Every Rose Has Its Thorn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poison

questions.question: Jump was released on the album 1984 by what band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Halen

questions.question: What solo artist had a hit with Like a Rolling Stone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: This hip-hop/RB duo consists of brothers DJ Minute Mix and Prince Be.  They scored an international hit in 1991 with Set Adrift on Memory Bliss.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: PM Dawn

questions.question: The music of Jan  Dean is often confused with works of The Beach Boys.  Both had a similar surf music style.  Which of the following songs was originally a hit for Jan  Dean and not The Beach Boys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead Mans Curve

questions.question: This Georgia based rap duo consists of André 3000 Benjamin and Antwan Big Boi Patton.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: OutKast

questions.question: This duo had a big hit with Superstar, a song about a groupie who still holds a strong love for a rock star after a one night stand.  The hopelessly depressing lyrics include the lines: Dont you remember! You told me you loved me, baby.  You said youd be coming back this way again, baby.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Carpenters

questions.question: What band had a hit with Come Sail Away?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Styx

questions.question: Andrew Ridgeley is the lesser known member of this pop duo formed in 1981.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wham!

questions.question: This band simply consists of the duo: Graham Russell and Russell Hitchcock.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air Supply

questions.question: A World Without Love was written by Paul McCartney, but was a hit for this duo rather than The Beatles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter  Gordon

questions.question: What metal band recorded Dr. Feelgood, a song referring to a drug dealer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Motley Crue

questions.question: This soft rock duo released the song heard in the audio clip in 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England Dan  John Ford Coley

questions.question: This duo achieved a number one hit in 1969 with a song that blatantly warned of the dangers of technology.  The song had no chorus, and contained such upbeat lyrics as: Im kinda wonderin if man is gonna be alive. Hes taken everything this old Earth can give, and he aint put back nothing, whoa-whoa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zager  Evans

questions.question: Simon  Garfunkel met in elementary school in 1953.  Just over ten years later, the duo was one of the most significant acts in the history of popular music.  Sadly, their collaboration ended in 1970.  Which of the following songs was recorded by Paul Simon after the split, as a solo artist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slip Slidin Away
